review.reviewBody: Good potential, but it feels like they got some details wrong. Nice material, good stretch, can be a little slippery. I wish there was more room in the crotch on these. Make sure you read the size chart--for some asinine reason size "32" is for a 34 inch waist, and "34" is for a 36 inch waist, etc. Also, I'm not in love with the ratchet craze
review.name: Make sure you read the size chart

review.reviewBody: The short feels really good. The material is very light weight and feels great to skin. The stretch is well balanced. Unclear how effective the side pocket is for heavier items like a phone. So far it is a great addition.
review.name: First impression. I really like it.

Hi, 

Thank you for your feedback. We understand that price is an important consideration for you. Our products are priced based on the high quality and value they offer.We strive to provide the best possible experience and believe our product will meet your expectations.

If you have any further concerns or questions, we're here to help.


Kind regards, 
Fanny
Dometic Sales Support

review.reviewBody:
Just got one of these cases, the build looks and feels great. 
I Iike that there not wasted space on the in side of the case unlike some of the plastic cases out there. 
We are overlanders and we are ruff on equipment it looks like this case is going to hold up. 
We have loaded it and because the case is so light it’s not that heavy the wife has no problem moving it around. The only problem I have is it only comes in one size..

review.reviewBody: Such a basic feature - would never have bought if I'd know it had been eliminated. ;-(
review.name: no flap jacket?

review.reviewBody: I'm super bummed about this pack… I got the Aura AG 50 L for a 2 night 3 day backpacking trip through Bryce Canyon and had a hard time. My personal issues about the pack: After 2 miles in, my hips became swollen and irritated due to the rigid hip belt. In order to keep the load close to my back I had to really cinch down the straps which caused tension. Second, the back suspension/ air way system seems like an amazing idea, but really it wasn't. I wanted to love it, but having the load off my back created an unbalanced load leaving me back heavy when going around unstable terrain (not what I want). I really loved the quality of the pack and amazing zippers that held up great. Each day I would hike I would have to unclip my hip belt and let my legs get more blood flow. Hips were left bruised and numb, my lower back hurt, BUT shoulders felt great. I tried re-packing and distributing weight many different ways so I knew it wasn't user error. I'm bummed this wasn't the pack for me:(
review.name: I would not buy this pack again.

name: Aura AG 50L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: This groundsheet sucks. 5 miles into the Backcountry, I carefully select my perfect campsite tucked high in a basin of the BOB Marshall wilderness. Of course, I've gone ultralight - sacrificing where I can to save precious ounces. I unfurl my brand new groundsheet, and to my shock and horror the sounds of crinkles, crackles and pops echo through the pristine wilderness. Hyberbole aside, this groundsheet is laughably loud and unusable. Horrible material choice for a groundsheet. Camped for 6 days without using it. Returned immediately upon getting home. Dont make the same mistake I did.
review.name: If I wasn't crying I'd be laughing

review.reviewBody: Great tyvek style ground tarp. The bag on the otherhand was an oversight. Once you unroll the tarp and use it--you will never get it back into the bag they supplied--the bag is just too small. Kind of annoying when you are paying $60 for a glorified piece of tyvek and they don't provide a functional bag.
review.name: Great tarp--terrible bag

name: Escapist Ground Sheet

review.reviewBody: As advertised, strong and reliable. I wish the name tag spot wasn't on the top but on the side as sweat while wearing it as a backpack caused the ink to bleed on the label just a knit pick
review.name: Good strong bag

review.reviewBody: I love this bag and actually thought the size small would be a bit bigger. Might get another! It feels very durable and love the pocket on the inside but also love that it's just one big compartment so I can use packing cubes for weekend trips and just toss all gear in there for adventures!
review.name: Durable & can organise the way I like!

review.reviewBody: Overall I am pleased with this bag. I was able to pack a weeks worth of midweight clothes, including tall kayaking boots. It fit easily in the overhead storage bin on the plane. I also like the neutral two-toned camel/brown color I chose. The zipper takes a tiny bit of patience, and the shoulder straps were brutal on bare shoulders.
review.name: Worked well for short trip

review.reviewBody: This video and his testimony is so powerful!, thank you, I enjoyed it and the duffels! We have a camo one to carry my (4) boys laser tag guns in! PS I work here :)
review.name: Probably one of the Best Product Videos EVER!

name: Base Camp S 50L Duffel Bag

review.reviewBody: These shoes are as comfortable as everyone says! Can be dressed down or up depending on the outfit. They're my new favorite sandals at the moment!

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a comfy sandal as I'm standing for hours in my volunteer assignment. Found THEM! Wish the black pair was available too. #jwsmpw

review.reviewBody: One of the greatest things about these shoes is the insole -- it makes me feel like I'm walking on a cloud. It so soft and comfortable. I was eyeing this shoe since the Spring and once it went on sale I had to purchase. I don't regret the wait... it was all worth it. LOVE THEM!!
review.name: Definitely purchase these shoes again. They are AWESOME!

review.reviewBody: I walked around Disney all day my feet did not hurt. Great pair of sandals.
review.name: I would buy this shoe again.

review.reviewBody: I have these in 2 colors! Most comfortable sandal. You could walk all day in these! Adjustable straps. Zero blisters!! 10/10!!'
review.name: Walking on a cloud!

review.reviewBody: I really like these sandals. Very comfortable and cute.
review.name: Comfy

review.reviewBody: Beautiful sandals, comfortable, light, soft to walk in, perfect for my feet with fasciitis. I recommend them.

review.reviewBody: Love these comfortable yet cute sandals. Can be worn with so many looks.
review.name: Cute and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: I love these so much! Cute and comfy! Glad I bought them!
review.name: So cute and so comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Light enough for your backpack, strong glue for the uphill.
review.name: Glidelite

review.reviewBody: Have always been a great skin. Glue holds up & great performance.
review.name: Great skins…

review.reviewBody: Skins work great! They came with a skin cutter that was easy to use making the cutting phase of the skins easy going
review.name: Skins

review.reviewBody: Got the 135 width for bent 110 and wow this is great in between glide and climbing! I tested this in Blackcomb and Whistler flute summit and fantastic! Easy to put on and easy to take off !
review.name: Found a skin that's great in between!

review.reviewBody:
Pros: great glide, super tacky glue. 

Cons: lack of grip, glue does not last. 

Ive used the skins for two weeks and the glue is peeling off when I am pulling them apart. I now have areas where the glue is missing. I am comparing my experience to Contour Hybrid Skins, which I have had a far superior experience with. The BD skins also do not climb as well as the Contours.
review.name: Contour Hybrid Are Better

review.reviewBody: II am really pleased with these sometimes 130 width skins can be heavy ad clunky and these are just awesome!
review.name: So light with great glide

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my son. but I used a pair all last year and loved them. No issues. Took my large framed body up anything I could do without much slipping. Seemed to glide better than previous skins I have used as well.
review.name: Perfect skins

review.reviewBody: I finally wore out my last pair of the same skins after a few years of heavy use. This was a no brainer to replace with the same skin. They have good glide and great grip when it counts on a steeper skin track.
review.name: These skins just work!

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my Atomic Bentchetler 184cm. Just need to cut side with special tool, super easy, no way to mess up. Very satisfy my purchase.
review.name: Easy to set up

review.reviewBody: Tried pomoca, and G3 ... always come back to black diamond skins for the quality of the glue and the durability.
review.name: Classics

name: 135mm Glidelite Mix FL Skins

review.name: Nice material, runs small

review.reviewBody: I loved the merino wool liner, but wish I had sized up. I didn't look at the sizing chart, so I'm not sure if that would have helped. I just bought my usual size and the band is too tight.

description: Buy the Thule Evo Clamp online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Evo Clamp
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Evo Clamp online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The new bars with a slice in the bottom took a great product and destroyed it just so they could say they had something new. The older square bars are by far stronger and there was no need to change them and make them weaker by putting a slice in the bottom. The previous foot pack held much stronger as well.
review.name: Bad Idea

review.reviewBody: I bought this to add on to my Toyota Tundra. I needed extra cargo space for a long trip. Traveled from Southern New Jersey to Lake of the Ozarks, Missouri, and back without any issues. These roof racks were perfect!
review.name: Exactly what I needed!

review.reviewBody: Works amazingly for every task we throw at it! Fairly easy instructions. The only issue we have had is, at least on our car, a loud whistling noise at 30-40mph. If that was reduced somehow I would give this a 5/5.
review.name: Almost perfect in every way!

review.reviewBody: ...and I thought, same basic thing I've bought over the years...   I was wrong.  Lots of thoughtful improvements to make it easier to install than ever.   Fit kit clamps snapped right in.  The instructions & measurements from the kit were super helpful.   Measurement marks on the bars are super helpful.
review.name: Owned Thule Racks for 30 years...

review.reviewBody: Well made and worked like supposed to. Fit my truck nicely.
review.name: Good fit. I even followed the instructions!

review.reviewBody: Fits my 2017 Elantra 4 door very good.  Just pay attention to the instructions and watch a couple of videos to help understand the installation.
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody: Bought a new car top carrier for a 2018 Chevy Colorado and it fit like a glove, looked sharp & worked great. Fast forward 6 years and I get a 2024 Nissan Frontier (a substantially better truck) and only needed to order the new feet & clamps for the Colorado carrier to fit the Nissan perfectly! A well designed product that will continue to serve me! Thank you Thule.
review.name: Great product lives on!

review.reviewBody: After wanting easy, I got easy and very sturdy, drove 45 mins to and from with (14’ old town) and had huge confidence with no problems, didn’t catch anything, but again hauling my boat confidently with no hassles is big deal, great product much better than it’s replacement.
review.name: No whistle, completed first Kayak expedition w/EVO

review.reviewBody:
This is a great rack but it doesn't fit my Tacoma as Thule said it would, it's to bad as these products are not cheap, 
Hope by down the road with anything car I will find a proper rack
review.name: I'm unfortunately doesn't fit as Thule said it wor

review.reviewBody: I love Thule products. I noticed that it's noisy sinced we installed it...
review.name: Great product, but noisy

name: Evo Clamp

review.reviewBody:
Obviously these boots are designed around cold conditions.   I've had a chance to use them about ten times.  Coldest day on a ridge at 10,600' or so...high winds and windchill and variable snow and in some spots glass-slick ice.  I added traction devices on this day (Kahtoola Microspikes) which fit over the boots perfectly and held in place.  The sole design is indeed suitable to lightweight traction devices.   

About an hour on the exposed ridge and no cold problems, no discomfort, and good flex and support in the boot.  It did not feel cumbersome and like something that was slowing me down.  A mountaineering boot is more nimble but this boot is far more stable then you would imagine for a snow boot.   

Descending the ridge I met up with some 'interesting snow conditions'.  A few inches of compacted breakable crust gave way to a couple feet of crud and cement.  I was postholing for a good half hour as could not find more stable snow.  I connected up to a worn trail and was able to enjoy being away from the breakable crust.  Two things to note: the microspikes did not come off the boots, and my feet did not get the slightest bit wet or cold, and the laces remained tight through the eyelets.

Next step will be to test them in conjunction with snowshoes...

Overall, great boots.   Baffin Control Max did indeed provide great balance and control...will have to see how they hold up over time...but so far so good.   Five stars.
review.name: Boots for cold and snow

review.reviewBody: Super warm boot. Used it out sledding with my kids and shoveling the driveway. I could see this being a perfect low activity boot such as ice fishing, shoveling, or sledding with the family. If I were to slap on some snow shoes and do a hike I would most likely be looking for a smaller boot. Still hiked a good mile in the snow with them though and they were comfortable.
review.name: Warm Boot

name: Control Max Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: I use this lube across my entire quiver of bikes.  It's light--I don't get a bunch of grime stuck to my drivetrain.  It's effective.  And It smells lovely to boot.  Your chain does get dry quickly in super dusty conditions so be prepared to reapply regularly.  But it's not really a big deal if you're doing a good job of maintaining anyway.  I just find I have to use it more often than some other lubes.  That said, this is one of my favorites to use.
review.name: Great Light Lube

description: Buy the Backcountry Oakbury Synthetic Quilted Parka - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Oakbury Synthetic Quilted Parka - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Oakbury Synthetic Quilted Parka - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have worn this in Alaska in sub 34 Fahrenheit temps and I’ve worn it around my city on a walk with the dog. It is comfortable, warm, and I get lots of compliments! It’s like wearing a giant blanket! 

The ONE downside is that it’s not very water resistant. I live in a rainy area and it absorbs the water. I have even washed it with waterproofing detergent and it hasn’t helped. I wish this was waterproof/resistant, but otherwise it’s my favorite coat!
review.name: Obsessed but one down side

review.reviewBody:
This is a great dog walking coat.  It’s not too heavy so you can layer underneath.  It’s roomy - which I wanted. The large pockets out front hold ALL the things.  Bags, phone, flashlight, keys… I really like the snap feature - when walking a zipper can make your stride shorter so I like being able to keep the bottom open and top closed. 

The only thing I would change - is add normal pocket with fleece lining would be amazing! (Don’t take away the front pockets) but having a nice place to warm my hands would be a nice add.
review.name: 😍 LOVE it!

review.reviewBody: Super cozy, like a sleeping bag, medium warmth . I’m 5’6”, 130lbs, and ordered a medium. I could have ordered a small but I wanted oversized for layering underneath. Medium warmth
review.name: Cozy, Runs large

review.reviewBody: It’s still early in the season for this jacket but I’ve worn it twice and love it. I wanted something longer than my fjallraven that I could toss on to walk the dogs. It’s cozy and I love the big pockets, the hood is nice and big too! I’m 5’3” and petite, the XS fits like a glove!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody:
I am 5’0, 100lbs and this jacket ENGULFS me… the arms are too long, the silhouette is unflattering and the olive color is a little drab, but I LOVE it. Because I’m so short it hits me about mid-calf, almost to my ankles, which I very much like. The large pockets can hold phones, keys, wallet and probably a can/bottle of your favorite beer. 

I’ve only used it in mild PNW winter/spring weather so can’t say how it holds up in colder temps but because it’s so spacious, you can layer up underneath. I used it in a downpour and it repelled water pretty well and didn’t get soaked through. The only downside is the hood is big and loose and you can’t tighten it so in any wind, it blows off and is useless. And I would prefer a zipper to the buttons, but it wasn’t a deal breaker for me. I would recommend purchasing this parka.
review.name: Cozy

review.reviewBody: This is nice! It's light yet warm. Not waterproof, but it doesn't claim to be. Feels like a big sleeping bag, in a good way. I'm usually a small or medium and tried both - went with the medium for layering purposes. The sleeves are a little long.
review.name: Nice coat

review.reviewBody:
The Oakbury synthetic quilted parka is amazing; it is warm and extremely light weight. It's like having a cloud of warmth surrounding your body keeping you oh so cozy but never weighed down. I am outside every day with a busy two year old and this parka has helped me to be unfazed by the chilly New England winter. The hood is perfectly proportioned, the  snaps go right up to your chin keeping out the cold and the longer length keeps my legs toasty warm! 
I highly recommend this parka
review.name: Light Weight Warmth

review.reviewBody: I bought this coat for a vacation in Portland, Maine.  It was fantastic for layering.  This year, my vacation was more like a spring vacation in the middle of winter in Maine.  I soo love this coat.  Light weight.  The color worked with my entire wardrobe.. Kept me warm, especially my legs, as I hiked for 6 miles at least each day. this coat was great for airplane. Two huge pockets and used as a blanket for legs on plane. The brown sugar color goes with so many beautiful colors of clothing.
review.name: THE MAINE COAT

review.reviewBody: I really like this style, excellent drop in pockets. I feel like for the price it should have an inner pocket too, but that's easy to add myself. The reason I returned it is because I didn't like the texture of the fabric on my skin and what I wanted this for was to be able to pop out to get mail etc. without having to put pants on. It would definitely work for that purpose and the fabric and drape would probably improve as it got worn in, I just have increased sensitivity to textures and the feel of things.
review.name: Solid coat to have for popping outside

review.reviewBody: I bought the green colorway and love it. This jacket is awesome, it is roomy so you can layer it and I just love the front pockets, so deep and I don’t have to worry about anything falling out
review.name: OBSESSED!!!!

name: Oakbury Synthetic Quilted Parka - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear First Tracks Insulated Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The coat is nice and well built. My issue is the breathability..... 2 days skiing and my forearms were soaked! This is not good for skiing! What is the solution after such a huge investment? 
The shoulders are not broad enough.  I'm 5'8" 150 in the medium. Id be swimming in a large.....
review.name: Bad breathabilty

review.reviewBody:
I'm glad I have this jacket... Breathable, waterproof,
insulated, recco.... everything I need is here... true to size, warm... yes, I recommend it... cool!...
review.name: body-mapped insulation jacket...

review.reviewBody: The quality is good and it’s very warm stays pretty dry!
review.name: Good cold weather coat

review.reviewBody: Love the jacket! layers well and its all about that PIT ZIPS, and the pass pocket! kept me warm and dry! im 5'7" 165 and i rocked the Medium
review.name: PIT ZIPS PASS POCKET!

review.reviewBody:
This is a good looking jacket, but I returned it for a couple reasons. 1) bulky. I’m 5’9 165 pounds and the medium felt massive! 2) waterproof questions. This coat has a ton of pockets, which is sweet. But the zippered pockets and the main zipper are not super well sealed. For a PNW boarder this felt risky of getting soaked. 

What I liked about this jacket: the color was really nice. It has so, so many pockets. Seemed super warm. 

Overall the negatives outweighed the positives for me
review.name: Pros and cons

review.reviewBody: Sick jacket, super warm with mad pockets great buy
review.name: My favorite board jacket yet

description: Buy the Hydro Flask 16oz Tall Boy online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 16oz Tall Boy
hasVariant.description: Buy the Hydro Flask 16oz Tall Boy online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great cooler cup! Bought as a gift for my grandma who uses it to hold 12oz water bottles
review.name: Love all my HydroFlasks

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A little difficult to use as a coosie. Hard to drink out of the top lip. They do a great job of just keeping a can of beer cold for a few hours. We go up skiing and don’t nessasarily want to pack a whole cooler. A nice cold beer if waiting for our apres ski parking lot shenanigan's
review.name: Tall boy cooler

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The 16oz tallboy cooler cup is awesome. I love a good craft beer so it goes great with my hydroflask growler at a weekend bbq or fire in “pint glass” mode. Also great when I have tall boy cans from the local brewery, they slip in nice and easy and keep my drinks nice and cool, looks great too. I’m glad I purchased it.
review.name: It’s awesome!

review.reviewBody: Love the versatility, being able to use it as a cooler for bottles/cans or as a drinking cup with the addition of the small closable, press in lid.
review.name: Dual purpose

review.reviewBody: I love my tall boy cooler cup for keeping tall cans cool. It also works great as a travel mug. My only complaint is it isn't really compatible with 12oz cans too (but I made a drop in insert from a plastic kids cup that works well; just need a way to not lose it).
review.name: Great multi function cooler cup

review.reviewBody: I like this somewhat better than other companies option, specifically the ones with the screw tops. It’s easier to use when it’s lower light trying to locate a dark top, it’s not as bulky, slightly lighter and it does what it is supposed to, keeps my drink cooler longer. It is winter so can’t tell if it’s the same during hot weather. Haven’t used it as a cup either yet.
review.name: Works the way it’s intended

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Both are great products, used on a daily basis. Fast shipping too!
review.name: Both are great products, used

review.reviewBody: Fits great in cupholder, keeps my drink cold. Great product.
review.name: Great Cup

review.reviewBody: Haven’t used yet but I expect it to be top quality like the other hydro flask products I own.
review.name: Beautiful

review.reviewBody: Bought it as a gift - I will assume they will love it, but I guess just because I do doesn’t necessarily mean they will - fingers crossed
review.name: Bought it as a gift

name: 16oz Tall Boy

review.reviewBody: These came with my QST echo 106's.  The tip loop stinks and wants to roll off the edge of the rounded ski tip. Replaced with a BD tip loop after the first tour. I also wish the tail grab was more of a BD bungee design with more elasticity to it. I'll likely replace those too in the future?  The skins are cut very precise to my skis and would have preferred more wiggle room and less edge to edge coverage. You need to be real precise when sticking them on.  6 tours so far.  Wish I would have just bought BD skins separately.
review.name: Tip loop stinks

review.reviewBody: The shoes are great are they the best shoes in the world? No but they are fantastic for what there made for I like them a lot they are my main climbing shoes. *extremely stiff when breaking them in*
review.name: Neutral/aggressive shoes

review.reviewBody: I usually use the Shaman model for bouldering and indoor climbing but it’s too soft for natural rock climbing. On the other hand, the Geshido has the perfect rigidity to climb with more comfort and precision. My feet get much less tired… I love them! …I find them very similar to the Velcro’s La Sportiva Miura, but with a much more comfortable toe with wifi fit
review.name: Wide fit with excellent performance on the rocks

review.reviewBody: I usually use the Shaman model for bouldering and indoor climbing but it’s too soft for natural rock climbing. On the other hand, the Geshido has the perfect rigidity to climb with more comfort and precision. My feet get much less tired… I love them! …I find them very similar to the velcro’s La Sportiva Miura, but with a much more comfortable toe.
review.name: Excellent performance on the rocks

review.reviewBody: This is my new favorite shoe however the tongue ripped within a week. I've seen other reports of the same issue, so hopefully Evolv will fix it.
review.name: Great shoe but ...

review.reviewBody: I've used these for a solid 6+ months at the gym going 3-4 days a week bouldering and top rope. Only now has the toe on the right foot worn through and needs resoled. The toe box on these is wider than most other shoes I've tried which makes them way more comfortable if you have a wider foot. I'm going to buy a second pair to have while the originals are being resoled. Very good shoe, breaks in well.
review.name: Excellent shoe, going to buy a second pair

review.reviewBody:
Great climbing shoe for all around performance. i use it especially for sport climbing face routes 7c/8a with tiny foot holds, but it also works in the gym and steeper terrain just as well.
Fits my classic foot shape like a glove. Cant recommend more.
review.name: Amazing climbing shoe

review.reviewBody: This shoe brought me into the start of climbing shoes and the introduction to climbing outside. Thought I quickly saw as my friends and other climbers was wearing softer shoes that how hard this shoe was impacted my climbing as a result, but some routes need that. After seeing the full life of this shoe before my eyes I'd say its a great buy but after 8 months of solid gym climbing you'd be onto your next more aggressive shoes. I have resoled and kept these in my arsenal for that next route that needs them and still find great results for them. Keep sending
review.name: Great starter to introduction shoe

review.reviewBody: I love evolv shoes. The rubber is great and they do a great job with the rubber on the heels. I own a pair of the shamans and use those outdoors. Bought these mainly for gym climbing. I always go up one shoe size in this brand. I wear a 8.5 street shoe and bought a 9.5 climbing shoe. They fit snug at this size up and are comfortable, although I still have trouble walking around the gym in them. To me this indicates a pretty good fit. I do think they will stretch slightly as I use them but since I'm using them in the gym I am fine with that.
review.name: Great aggressive shoe

review.reviewBody: This shoe fits wider than the shaman or oracle. materials are comfy and the simple velcro straps are good. If they had included the "love bump" that is on the shaman and oracle it would have helped this shoe fit amazingly. Sadly it wasn't included.

Love this new version of the Geshido.  I had a pair four/five years ago and resold two times and loved that shoe.  This new one didn't disappoint either.  Feels more cambered than the old one and fits better in the heel too.  Great all around do anything shoe.  I wear a 10 in street shoes and went with a 10 in these for a comfortable but still snug fit.  Since these are all synthetic, I know they won't stretch out and get baggy over time.  Love that about evolv.
review.name: Great new shoe from Evolv

name: Geshido Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I won’t buy any other shoe! I love that they don’t stretch much so breaking them in is a breeze. They are great for small nubs, smears, everything.
review.name: Best comfy, all around, performance shoe

review.reviewBody:
I've been using these shoes for 90% of my outdoor climbing for over 6 years with no end in sight. 

From tufas in El Salto, pockets in Lander, the 14-pitch Original Route on the Rainbow Wall in Red Rocks, and friction dependent micro-feet in Boulder Canyon... I have used them for it all. Other than the steepest of steep boulders or true crack climbing, these are my go to climbing shoes with I need power + precision.

Great for those with a narrow heel or high arch - I have found these to be the most versatile, responsive, and comfortable performance shoe on the market.
review.name: Most comfortable performance shoe

name: Iati Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody:
Bought a few of these to use on day excursions while in Europe and they are fantastic!  Kept everything dry even in 2 hour downpour.  
Packs down to fit anywhere in your luggage but still has shape and is comfortable to carry (padded straps and back) when wearing.  
Looks small at first glance,  but when you start loading it up- everything fits!  Love the pocket’s especially the stretchy water bottle sleeve style, which easily fits -and secures- up to 32 ounce stainless steel bottles.  
Husband is an airline pilot and uses it ALL the time.  It’s become a staple in his work bag.
review.name: Perfect packable!  A must have!

name: ReFraction 16L Packable Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The tek towel is amazing!!! I brought it on a 8 day Kilimanjaro summit and used it every day. It was so cold on the mountain and I needed to dry as quickly as possible. The tea towel literally dries on the first swipe, you don’t need to make a second pass. I love it so much in going to buy more just to use at home!
review.name: Incredible towel!!!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I guess I wasn’t really happy with this purchase at all. The size I ordered for the price didn’t seem to match. It was way too expensive for what the price was that I paid.
Also, it wasn’t absorbent at all. It was tiny and basically was just just as a face drying towel and a hair wrap that didn’t cover all of my hair. I was disappointed in the size for the money. Not the greatest quality.
review.name: small size

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It really dries you, clings as you use it. Takes longer to dry than I anticipated. Very light weight
review.name: Amazing towel

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great towel at a great pack size. Has a great feel and dries easily.
review.name: Tek Towel

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am now the happy owner of three Tek Towels (size large). One I've had for around five years; two are new. (I regret waiting so long before I ordered more.) The large size has been perfect for my needs (travel, work in the field and office, and gym); it packs small. Also, its soft, asborbant, and dries fast. Highly recommended. Perfect to keep in your vehicle, desk, locker, etc.
review.name: Love These Towels

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A little smaller than I was expecting but drys quickly and absorbs water well.
review.name: A little smaller than I

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is hands-down the best camp towel I’ve ever purchased. The texture is so good: soft but you can still use it to scrub a little. It actually absorbs water, and FAST, unlike other camp towels that just move water around. I will probably keep using it at home too. I bought the XL which is big enough to wrap around me (I’m a size 16 so that is not the case with most towels). Very light weight and drys quickly. Worth every single penny.
review.name: Best camp towel ever!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great, lightweight towel, very absorbent. Great for swimming and sailing.
review.name: Great, lightweight towel, very absorbent.

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This towel is great for camping, hiking, etc -- not sure about backpacking given the size/box-y ness of the container. 

It really came in handy during my camping trip to Yellowstone. It comes with a tab that makes it easy to hang up, which is efficient for drying the towel after its been washed or in general.

I happened to catch some trout during my trip to Yellowstone, and was able to use one of the towels to support the cooking process. Afterwards I used my sea to summit sink to wash the towel, and hung it up to dry so that it could be used for other purposes.
review.name: Great Towel

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The extra large is a good size. The towel folds down into its case so it is reasonably small and easy to pack. It soaks up a lot of water and yet dries quickly. And it does not have that scratchy microfiber feel. Bought one for myself and one for my son for our high adventure trip to Alaska. We both enjoyed our towels and their packability.
review.name: Would purchase again

name: Tek Towel

review.reviewBody: Overall good quality backpack for outdoor activity. However, I wish it had longer, or adjustable shoulder straps.
review.name: Good built quality, but shoulder straps is non-adjustable

review.reviewBody:
I thought it would be a great summit backpack for snow mountain adventures, extremely lightweight, and suitable for carrying an ice axe. It would be even better if it included a waist strap. Very suitable for packing into a large backpack.
Currently trying it for short-distance day hikes, very satisfied.
review.name: nice

review.reviewBody: You can go to war with this thing. They say it’s an ultra pack, but it is also the most comfortable pack I’ve ever used for MTB’ing. As far as how much stuff it stores, it hits way above its weight! You can pack this thing to the gills. It’s also surprisingly water tight! I’ve carried this in downpours only to find my stuff perfectly dry. For light packs w/o frames, I will never buy a different pack for the rest of my life. I now own a distance 8 and 12 because they are so great.
review.name: Pack so nice, bought it twice

review.reviewBody: I wanted a light bag. So I don't regret my choice. It's light and has good storage. It will be useful when hiking. This bag is very famous. There's a reason why it's loved so much. I'll find out by using this bag.
review.name: Simple backpack

review.reviewBody: Bought another one that was a little bigger for longer sends.
review.name: Big fan…

review.reviewBody:
Incredible backpack for outdoor adventures! This 15-liter backpack is perfect for short hikes and day trips. Its compact and lightweight design makes it comfortable to carry, and the back adjustment feels very ergonomic, even after several hours of use.

The materials are high quality and water-resistant, which gave me peace of mind on a couple of rainy days. Additionally, it features several well-distributed compartments that allow for efficient organization: from my water bottle to snacks and a small jacket.

One aspect that really surprised me is the comfort of the straps, which are padded and fit perfectly. It also has a ventilation system on the back that helps keep you cool, something very appreciated on hot days.

In summary, this 15-liter backpack has exceeded my expectations. It's ideal for those looking for a lightweight and functional companion for their excursions. I highly recommend it!
review.name: Best Option for Beginner and experience hikers

review.reviewBody: Runs secure. Plenty of space and cinches down when you don’t need all the space.
review.name: Great scrambling pack

review.reviewBody: Love this pack. Holds a bunch of layers well, straps up front have the pockets you would expect of a vest. Feels fine running downhill with minimal bounce. 10/10 would buy again
review.name: Vest or back pack

review.reviewBody: Comfy, lightweight, surprisingly spacious. The perfect pack for full day trail adventures.
review.name: Comfy, lightweight, surprisingly spacious. The

review.reviewBody: Use this almost daily for trail running. It rides very well. I usually have very little in it but the compression straps work great and it is nice to have the option to carry more. The water bottle sleeves fit just right. A couple of suggestions for the next model: 1) when the pack is almost empty, it would be nice to have an additional spot (or even a mini daisy chain) to hook the closure for the roll top. 2) i like having the option to carry a hydration bladder, but it would be great if there were a snap or a little piece of velcro to close this compartment when not in use. otherwise things get lost in there. 3) i love the zipper pocket on the front--would love another one on the other side. 4) the pack has some mysterious features. what is the little slot on the front with the two little pieces of metal? what are the weird removable velcro straps? i think the straps are for trekking poles? some documantation would be helpful...
review.name: great pack

name: Distance 15L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I had bought a pair of the insoles for a boot they no longer sell (I can’t find them anywhere) and the stitching was the best and they also seem to have too much material on top because both insoles are bunched up on top of my foot making the boots unwearable. I have a size 8 boot and bought a size 8 insole. I had to return the 1st pair I bought because the guy gave me the wrong size but now I will have to make a 3rd trip to bring them back again and have to find a new boot that will work. The older things Sorel made have been great but now I am going to have to find another brand of boots. I live in Northern NH and it is very cold and snowy here. It’s too bad because I have been buying Sorel boots for 40 yrs.
review.name: Not made like they use to/Insoles don’t fit right
comment: Hello LoriLach, we want to extend our apologies concerning your experience. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.reviewBody: Bought these boots for my cold and snowy Michigan winter. They have worked great. They have kept my feet dry and warm. They are a little on the heavy side. I ordered a size 7.5 and have room for thick socks.
review.name: Warm & Dry in Michigan Winter

review.reviewBody: These were much wider and heavier than I expected. Also the sizing was a bit small. I love the style though and I’m sure if a proper snow boot is what you need they are exactly it.
review.name: Not for every day

review.reviewBody: These boots are just as adorable in person as on the website. I was so excited to wear them, but unfortunately they are too small. I didn't even have thick socks on. So I agree with a previous reviewer about disregarding the Sorel advice - order a size up. I ordered them at a sale price, but now I'll have to buy them in the bigger size at a higher price. Ugh.
review.name: Cute, but too small

review.reviewBody: I’m leaving a three star review for these in fact for all of shoes and boots they have the best look in shoes, but no arch support!!
review.name: NO arch support in any of their products
comment: Hello jade4444, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry CARIBOU™ Women's Waterproof Boot didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.reviewBody: These boots are SO cool. Super comfy and I loved the look of them BUT I had to return because they are just super bulky and I feel like I would need to be in deep heavy snow to wear them :/ Such a shame - wish there was a slightly more delicate version :)
review.name: Gorgeous Snow Boots

review.reviewBody: They are warm and so comfortable.  I finally found the perfect boot.   I love the sorrel brand.  Quality and style you can count on.
review.name: Love these.   I’ve been looking a long time for the perfect winter boot.

review.reviewBody: Tried these on as soon as they came, and I love the fit and the style. I can't wait for winter to officially begin
review.name: In love with these already

review.reviewBody: Really beautiful boots bought for snowy Copenhagen. I needed a size larger than my usual size 5, but the size 6 are perfect.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: This is the third pair of these boots over the years.  I wear them a lot, snowshoeing, walking the dog, shoveling and running errands, when the conditions require it.  The last pair lasted me over 20 years.  So I didn't even look elsewhere.
review.name: Lifetime Fan

review.reviewBody: Great fit, great gore, Iike these pants very much!!!
review.name: Baker Proof

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These pants are soooo comfy! Flattering fit with room to move. Very happy with my choice!!
review.name: Love them!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very warm and comfortable. The high waist is great, and is tight enough to stay up without being uncomfortable. Even though I’m a little tall, the length is perfect as well.
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these pants! The waistband is super nice and sits high rise on me, makes the pants super comfortable. The lining is super soft which is great, and I also love the vents on the inside of the thighs. My favorite part about these pants though is the boa compatible liner, that goes over the boot. So convenient!
review.name: Overall great pants

review.reviewBody: Awesome fit, look, and materials. Always a dependable brand for snowboarding gear!
review.name: Awesome Gear!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect fit! (Little loose, skater look, not sloppy though) no need for a belt the elastic holds them up nicely.

Im 5’ 9” 170lbs

Gortex is a game changer, I never knew till I knew and now I know. Rode the whole day in pow and was never wet or cold. My friends, 5k, 10k, 15k gear all wet and cold by end of day of riding. Me cozy. Best pants I own now.
review.name: These pants are bad asf.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought as a gift for Christmas daughter very happy with pants.
review.name: Bought as a gift for

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought these in XS of this newer version bc the last version's reviews said they were way too long and big, even for XS. Since they redesigned it and I needed a new pair of gore tex,I wanted to give these a try. 

I'm 5'2, 118lb and these fit just right as far as waist and thighs. The length is still way too long but I can live with that. The waist has stretchy sides so there's room to move. The thighs are just right as well and feels super warm. These are by no means fitted though. They still look super baggy on me. Wish they would design a more fitted design. 

The color looks great. It's like a pink with a hint of gray. Now I want to get the matching jacket.
review.name: Pretty darn good!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really love how these fit overall. I am 5'2' and 170 lbs, the Large fits great and they're not to wide legged or long on me so love how they fit. For people that are taller than me saying they are too long, maybe they didn't try them on with their boots or don't use them for snowboarding cause the length it perfect on me once I have my snowboard boots on.

I only wish it had an adjustable waist band. The Large fits great but with time the waist band will stretch or if I lose some weight there's going to be no way to tighten the waist band so that's why I am giving it 4/5 stars. I wish there was a way to tighten the waist or at least have the belt loops to add a belt.
review.name: Overall great!

review.reviewBody: I am 5'9 and 165 lbs, and I'm normally a size 10 or 12. My low waist is in 34", and my hips are 42". I ordered both a L and an XL based on their sizing chart to see what would fit best. Even the large is 3-4 inches too big in the waist, and the don't have an adjustable waist or belt loops the way most brands do.
review.name: These are HUGE

review.itemreviewed: Organic Cotton Midweight Fjord Flannel Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: I'm happy with this flannel because it's medium weight, great cotton feel. The fit is comfortable and not to loose. Length is great to leave out or tuck in. It washed great and I hung to dry. For info I'm 5'3" 140lb and ordered lg.
review.name: Perfect Flannel

review.itemreviewed: Organic Cotton Midweight Fjord Flannel Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: Had to return and size up. Especially with it being 100% cotton.
review.name: Runs very small

review.itemreviewed: Organic Cotton Midweight Fjord Flannel Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: Patagonia Fjord flannels are soft, durable and flattering! Same with the midweight. I love that it's long enough and has big enough arms, without being boxy and drowning in the torso! For all the muscular/larger armed folks out there.
review.name: Always a win

review.itemreviewed: Organic Cotton Midweight Fjord Flannel Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: The organic cotton is soft and nicely ?fluffed? making this a nice snuggly companion on camping trips.  The blue is a beautiful color!  I?m between a M and a S, being 5?4? & 118 lbs with broad shoulders, yet a small chest and waist.  I choose M so I could get it on over another L/S shirt easily.  It fits well even after washing and drying.  I didn?t notice but a smidge of shrinkage.   I?d have given it 5 stars except for 2 things; no locker loop for hanging, and buttons instead of a snap placket.  To me flannels are worn like a light jacket, and snaps rather than buttons for easy on and off makes more sense to me than fiddling with buttons.
review.name: Cozy and soft Fiord Flannel

name: Organic Cotton Midweight Fjord Flannel Shirt - Women's

hasVariant.name: Back-Roller Pro Plus Panniers - Pair
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ortlieb Back-Roller Pro Plus Panniers - Pair online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Why are Ortliebs the most widely used panniers in the world? Okay, I get it now. This model comfortably holds a great deal of your gear, I consider them lightweight (particularly given their level of durability - I know of folks who have owned and used these for many happy years of cycle touring), being waterproof is a huge plus, they are well designed and fit pretty much any rear rack (and are adjustable), and they are easy to secure on to your rack, to remove them from your rack, and carry them around using their built-in handles. They're all I could ask for in panniers, including their reflective safety badge facing on-coming cars/trucks/buses. Totally sold on Ortlieb and now also own their bikepacking saddle and handlebar packs.
review.name: Arguably the best panniers in the world

hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I want to start off by saying I love this sleeping bag and it is crafted magically. I am 6ft with a broader build and went with the regular and it fits absolutely perfect, spacious enough for me to move around pretty comfortably without getting twisted up. However, it sleeps AT LEAST 15F colder than the comfort temp :( 
I took it down to 29-30F and absolutely froze, luckily I had an extra  25F quilt to throw over but even with that I was still pretty darn cold. I was wearing 240 Merino wool base layers and down booties, so wasn’t like I was naked. I find the ISO temperature ratings to be all over the place unfortunately. I would probably say this is a 27F LIMIT and 38F COMFORT bag, as opposed to the labeled 17F limit and 28F comfort.
review.name: Beautifully crafted and cozy, but cold…

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: As a side sleeper this spoon-shaped bag gives plenty of room and allows for flipping side to side.  I have this bag in both 30 and 15 degree rating.  The 15 degree bag has performed well in temperatures below freezing.  Paired with a Nemo Tensor wide sleeping pad it becomes a great sleep system.  Keep up the great work Nemo!!!
review.name: Great night sleep with great features

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: The quality of Nemo sleeping bags is phenomenal. My husband and I buy only Nemo sleeping bags because we love them so much. I recommend this bag to all my friends and so many have been sold because of it. They all love them too!
review.name: Perfect sleeping bag

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: This bag is very comfortable as a side sleeper and love the extra through that went into it like gills, no catch zips, draft collar, and...wait for it...a pillow sleeve in the hood! Plus, as an endless promise and Nemo's amazing warranty, it's worth spending extra on this!
review.name: Solid bag

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: The bag is warm, but as a warm sleeper the footbox and vents really allow me to stay comfortable overnight.  This also comes with a compression sack which is super helpful for packing.  10/10!
review.name: All-Around Great

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: This bag is so comfy and warm. Game changer for a side sleeper like myself!
review.name: Great sleeping bag!

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: The RIFF 15 has been the best bag I’ve ever used. I work at an outdoor store and have tried some Kelty down bags and a Big Agnes 3 in 1. Although those bags have their perks, the RIFF fits all my needs and I have been extremely happy with it. I can proudly say I have converted to Nemoism.
review.name: Hands down best sleeping bag.

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’ve had the same Kelty mummy bag for 12 years and thought I’d never have to buy another sleeping bag again. I’m a side sleeper and the spoon shape was such an easy sell for me. I love my old bag but the Nemo RIFF is just so roomy I never want to sleep in a regular mummy bag ever again! The venting gills are a realistic feature that I’m happy made it to the final product. 10/10 love this bag!
review.name: Leg room!

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Ordered this bag ahead of a Colorado elk hunt last fall and I was super impressed with the weight to warmth ratio and just how comfy this bag is. Since that trip I’ve used this bag for bike packing trips and several backpacking adventures and I continue to love this bag more and more. 

I’m a side sleeper so the spoon shape of the riff is a really a nice feature.  If you who feel trapped inside of a regular mummy bag, give the riff a shot. I can’t recommend this bag enough and plan on using it for many many years to come.
review.name: Couldn’t be happier

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: Had no idea what I was missing before I spent my first night in this bag. You barely notice it in your bag and it lofts out quite nicely. 10/10 would recommend.
review.name: Lightweight, Warm, So Comfortable

name: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's

review.reviewBody: Lovely looking fleece and style. Bought a M (5'9" and 84kg). Arms fit ok, but long in the body and a little baggy. Pockets are mesh which is just odd.
review.name: Odd fit!

review.reviewBody: I am a muscular build, 5'8" at 210 pounds, I often outgrow things in the arms, so I order an XL in some brands to allow space for the arms. Similar to another review, I found that the arms are very tight in the elbow area, not the bicep, rather the elbow at the point of flexion. Absolutely does not allow for a base layer in the arms. I will begin the return process and update my view on the brand. Apparently the tags are absolutely CRITICAL for a return, so don't lose them!
review.name: Terrible fit

review.reviewBody:
Beautifully made Fleece.
Fully Functional and made with recycled materials.
review.name: Vardag Fleece

review.reviewBody: Wonderful quality, comfortable, warm flannel/fleece type shirt. I highly recommend.
review.name: Flannel shirt

review.reviewBody: Excellent Fleece. Very Warm. Great as a mid-layer under a shell when it's really cold or wet (especially in the UK). Great over a base-layer in cold-mild temperatures. The pile does well to keep any wind out.
review.name: Excellent. Warm & Looks Good.

review.reviewBody: I own already the Greenland pile fleece in charcoal grey. Which I absolutely love. Bought this as an alternative colour way. Slightly cheaper but Unfortunately the quality is not the the same. Especially the pocket linings is very cheap, also it is black. On a white fleece. I found this to be rather strange. Love this brand and own lots of things but this is by far the most disappointing item I have purchased so far. I have given 3 stars but expect 5 stars from fjallraven at this price point
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: Chose a fleece because they are so much more durable than a Puffa jacket (how many of you ripped a Puffa?) This jacket is so warm & very wind resistant. Deducted 1 star because the chest pocket is not big enough to securely hold an iPhone.
review.name: Excellent Fleece

review.reviewBody:
This fleece looks great, can be dressed up or down and its a good mid-layer. However, there are some pretty major issues that I noticed upon first putting it on. First, the fit, I am 5'9" and 180lbs, I can wear the Greenland Winter jacket in a Medium without it being too tight, for some reason I had the thought to order a Large in this fleece with the hopes of it being a little loose. The length and fit are actually perfect, however the arms are very skinny particularly in the elbow area, I have fairly skinny arms and the sleeves are still quite tight at the elbow. The second issue is the pockets, it has two hand pockets and two additional pockets inside, however these pockets are not lined, they are mesh. I just wore this jacket around the block in 45 degree weather and my hands were cold inside the pockets due to the draft coming from the bottom of the jacket. This just seems crazy to me, maybe there is a practical reason for this, but when I wear a fleece with pockets, I'd like for those pockets to be as warm as the rest of the jacket.

All that being said, I am still conflicted regarding whether or not to keep it. It does look fantastic and it is warm. Perhaps the sleeves will stretch out, but I'm not sure what to do about the pocket issue,
review.name: Almost perfect, but the flaws really take it down a peg

name: Vardag Pile Fleece Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the MSR Autoflow XL10L Gravity Filter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Autoflow XL10L Gravity Filter
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Autoflow XL10L Gravity Filter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Works great. Wish it came with a second bag to fill.
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: I tried this out at home before I left. 6L in 13 minutes. Which was awesome! When I really needed it to work when filtering water at a spring in the Grand Canyon, it trickled out and cost us an extra half hour. I tried backflushing. Nothing worked to make it faster. Later on the same trip it worked fast like it did when I first tested it. It's a bit of a bummer not being able to count on it to always be fast. I will still use it though. When it is working as it should it saves a ton of hand pumping time and hassle.
review.name: Amazing and fast!

review.reviewBody: This is a wonderful filter to take with a group or when you anticipate needing a lot of water. It filters quickly. It’s easy to set up and use. I like being able to fill the bag and walk away as it fills our water bottles.
review.name: Perfect for thirsty groups

review.reviewBody: I should have tested this filter before going on the trip, but our first night we hung the bag to get some water and it took us an hour to get it to start barely dripping out. We made sure there were no air bubbles, pushed water through on both sides to flush it, and to no avail. For the next 7 days we managed to get the fastest rate of about a liter every half hour. Luckily, I had a steriPen for a backup. Our water sources were spring fed creek and rivers here in Alaska so sediment was not the issue. Now that I'm back home I'm testing it in the kitchen and it barely works. Unfortunately this must be a faulty product, and it was my fault that I didn't test this before I left so I could have left it behind.
review.name: Very, very slow

review.reviewBody: If you screw the filter too tightly on the Nalgene, it won’t flow. Perfect for us! After we figured it out.
review.name: If doesn’t flow, loosen cap on Nalgene

review.reviewBody:
After using my consistently reliable MSR MiniWorks for about 20 years, I decided it was time to upgrade to the AutoFlow XL for our annual trip to the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, in Minnesota on the Canadian border. With three of us to filter water for, I did not want to have to pump that much water by hand each day! I knew I could depend on MSR for a dependable water filter. The Autoflow XL was AWESOME. Scoop up 10 L dirty water and filter it into my collapsible 8 L wide-mouth collapsible canteen or 1 L Nalgene bottles. I love that it screws right onto my wide mouth bottles, and it's easy to shut-off while changing clean bottles. I'll still use my MiniWorks for solo trips, but AutoFlow XL worked fast and easy, with no pumping!

The only downside was on the first day we used it, we accidentally left the hang strap attached to the tree when we packed up to leave our campsite the next morning, and didn't realize it until we made camp later that night in a different campsite. We managed to hang it up in a tree using paracord, but I'm hoping to find where to order a replacement strap.

Bottom line: EXCELLENT FILTER, fast and easy to filter water, backflow to clear debris if clogged worked well, and it was simple to clean for long-term storage when I returned home. Thanks for another great product MSR!
review.name: MSR does it again! Another fantastic water filter. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

review.reviewBody: So far, love this. It's simple and light. Love having a bank of water in camp and definitely loved not having to pump while chasing my 3-yo around camp. The only thing that was a little tricky was getting water from a super shallow stream into the bag w/ out another cup or something. Not a biggie though.
review.name: Light, easy, great so far

review.reviewBody:
Shame on me for not testing this filter before I went backpacking. Luckily we had backup filters. I finally got the chance to try out my new Christmas present in July. The instructions make it sound like you just scoop water, connect the hoses and one minute later you have almost 2L of clean water. No prep, back flow, etc needed. Not the case!

I did research online when I got back from my trip to see if I missed a step, nope. I'm now timing it to see how long it takes to get 1L of clean water. I think IV bags drip faster. 33 Minutes later my 1L Nalgene is full! Ugh. I've always thought MSR was a top outdoor brand but this is super disappointing. I've submitted a customer support ticket and hope they backup their product.
review.name: SOOOOOO SLOW out of the box

review.reviewBody: My favorite filter. Use it for marginal water sources in the desert for work (trails, wilderness stewardship) and for pleasure. Dependable, robust. With the back flow function, and a preliminary container to settle out with alum, this filter can handle the muddiest, most marginal water when you really need it deep in desert backcountry. (please keep making it!)
review.name: Best filter for the desert.

review.reviewBody: Love the larger dirty water bag over the previous version. Speed is also great for group backpacking.
review.name: Love the larger dirty water

name: Autoflow XL10L Gravity Filter

review.name: This doesn’t work well with

review.itemreviewed: Dash X FM Child Bike Seat
review.reviewBody: Love this child seat. The tilt is great for when the baby falls asleep on rides. It’s easy to take of and put back on, since we store our bikes hanging.
review.name: Dash X FM

review.itemreviewed: Dash X FM Child Bike Seat
review.reviewBody: Bought the Dash X FM after thorough research. Seemed to offer the best bang for your buck out there - security, ease of use, recline ability, and I really liked the idea of the storage area. The product has not disappointed. I am very pleased. If I was being nit-picky, I would say it could use a bit more suspension to reduce jostling. 5 stars though.
review.name: Very impressive product

review.itemreviewed: Dash X FM Child Bike Seat
review.reviewBody: My baby loves this seat and it was easy to attach to our bike!
review.name: My baby loves this seat

review.itemreviewed: Dash X FM Child Bike Seat
review.reviewBody: Great, safe, easiest decision in child bike options.
review.name: Get it.

review.itemreviewed: Dash X FM Child Bike Seat
review.reviewBody: Love this product only thing that would make it better is a sun shade. It was easy Toni stall and very secure. Baby loves it.
review.name: Perfect

review.itemreviewed: Dash X FM Child Bike Seat
review.reviewBody: Works great. Had an issue with the mounting block but customer service replaced it quickly.
review.name: Works great. Had an issue

review.itemreviewed: Dash X FM Child Bike Seat
review.reviewBody: This was super easy to install and my daughter loves it! Now we get to ride bikes as a family again!!
review.name: Love it!

review.itemreviewed: Dash X FM Child Bike Seat
review.reviewBody: The primary selling point for me was the 5-point harness. At least at the time that I was researching child bike seats, Burley's was the only seat offering this feature. The storage compartment in the back of the seat is handy too, and is large enough for a u-lock, extra diapers, or the snack that you acquire at the cafe down the street. The recline feature is nice for younger kids who may fall asleep on the ride. I have it mounted to a Trek 520.
review.name: Great Seat

review.itemreviewed: Dash X FM Child Bike Seat
review.reviewBody: These seats are amazing! We have two due to our twins. We were concerned if we would have an issue with putting them on due to my brake line along the frame but wound up having no issue. The seats are easy to put on and take off. The incline was great when my daughter fell asleep on a ride. The back pockets are fantastic for keeping small things with us. There is plenty of space between us and the kids, when in the seats. I have no issue putting them in or taking them out while holding the bike up- very easy. My kids enjoy having the arms to rest their arms on. The best part is The safety aspect of the harness and locking system for their feet. We wound up having a spill due to a muddy bridge on a greenway and the kids were perfectly fine, no injuries , and barely moved. I highly recommend these seats.
review.name: Love them!!

name: Dash X FM Child Bike Seat

review.reviewBody:
This is a relaxed fit for tall people with wiry builds, which I'm not (I'm 5'9", 170lbs)
They pretty much made a "Big and Tall" shirt but just the "Tall" part. Everything is extended longer, but I wouldn't call it "relaxed". It has a snug fit around the chest, a comically long torso that goes to my thighs, and the arm holes just go further down my arm. It doesn't really drape off my shoulders the way other relaxed fit shirts do. I need to get some stuff tailored and I honestly might throw this in there and have them cut the torso shorter. It's a cool shirt, I like it, but the Relaxed Fit is executed strangely.

review.reviewBody: Without hesitation, this has to be the most comfortable and natural feeling bib that I have worn. I have purchased three or four of these and I won’t wear anything else, no issues with a sore bum no matter how long I ride as long as I wear these LG bibs.
review.name: My personal favorite

review.reviewBody:
I have owned four pairs of these over the last six years, and they are now the only ones I wear. I have slowly but surely eliminated other shorts. The fit is snug, with no chafing or bunching, and with good compression. The chamois is very durable. My oldest pair is now 5 years old, and I still use it (I ride about 5k miles/year and rotate all four). Shoulder straps are soft and comfortable, and the back is cool for long summer days in the saddle. 

I am 6'-0", 164lbs, and Large fits me perfectly.

Highly recommend
review.name: My Absolute Favorite Bibs

review.reviewBody: I am 5'9", around 240 lbs.  I have a couple LG bibs from about 7 years ago that are 2XL which fit me very well, so I ordered this in a 2XL.  This is very small, could barley get it over my muffin top.  I suspect LG now thinks of 2XL as being for skinny people that are tall.  I will have to stick to the company that make cycling clothing specifically for us big but not tall guys.
review.name: Runs very small

review.reviewBody: Comfort was 5-Star but the fit didn't match the comfort. I'm 6'2" and 170 lbs.  I ordered XL to make certain they were long enough on my thigh/leg.  They were but there is no grip around the bottom of the legs and the shorts immediately rode up my thighs way beyond my tan lines. I am returning them.
review.name: Ok but not my favorite

name: CB Carbon 2 Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: While training for the Grand Canyon Rim to Rim (24 miles), i did 4 local hikes in So. UT to prepare with an Osprey backpack, and each hike brought more discomfort to my shoulders, only to find out a week before R2R that I had some spine/rib alignment issues causing the sensitivity, and was going to need a lumbar hip pact if I was going to survive.  This pack saved me, transferring all my baggage and water (about 10-12 pounds) to my hips.  My shoulders felt soooo much better, and the weight on my hips was much easier on my upper body.  My only complaint is that all the weight pulls against the waist strap, which has to be pulled tight across the stomach to get proper lumbar support.  The extra pull was uncomfortable across my stomach (from sharp edges, not the weight), so I rigged up a pad with a rolled up T-shirt that worked out just fine.  By the time I finished the hike, I had totally designed (in my mind) a slip-over pad to cushion the strap from my stomach.  Tightening the waist strap is the only way to keep the bag against your back to properly transfer the weight.  I recommend taking a foam pad with you.  They have shoulder straps (not included, should be) to assist in this, and I will try them next.  Overall, I love the pack - I just wish I had it on my training hikes to get accustomed to it - but off the shoulders is a winner!
review.name: getting the weight off my shoulders!

name: Day 13L Lumbar Pack

hasVariant.name: District 24L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch District 24L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this for myself as a treat for getting to my last year of graduate school. I tend to go through bags fast and have difficulty having one that keeps up with me and does not wear down. I use this bag for everything, I travel with it, go to work, class, and my internship. It is about 5 months old and looks brand new. The load lifters are a game changer for an everyday backpack and the storage and organization are great. This is a well made bag and I do not see myself needing a new or different bag for quite some time. Im very happy with this purchase.
review.name: Best bag I own

review.reviewBody:
I fly hot air balloons and originally bought this to carry all my ballooning gear and electronics.  This is a pretty tough task, and ended up giving to my daughter because i needed more admin.  I ended up buying another one though because it works great in about every other situation, office, school, weekend trip, get home, etc.  

Only pack I have that can fit my 36oz Yeti Rambler.

Excellent quality and features.
review.name: Great versatile backpack

review.reviewBody: I had been searching for a smaller backpack that would be easy to use when traveling with my laptop on airlines.  The product is excellent and is the best of all the products on the market for this purpose.
review.name: District 24

review.reviewBody:
This is my first MR pack and I'll definitely be trying out their other offerings. I got the black colorway and can confirm as of this writing that it comes with the orange interior; I've seen reviews all over the internet that report different colored interiors so I thought I'd mention this. I probably could've done with the smaller District 18, but the larger 24 just gives me that extra volume in case I need it. The materials and construction are great.

I have a 16" MacBook Pro in a heavy duty protective case and it easily slips in the laptop sleeve in the main compartment. I love how you can configure the main compartment to what will work for you. The main compartment will easily swallow up the usual stuff that I'll bring during a quick hike, exploring a new locale, or as a carry-on for airline travel. While the harness isn't adjustable it's actually pretty comfortable even with an atypical 25-lb load that I tried out for a day.

Everyone is going to have their own wants and needs in this type of pack. That said, here are some things I'd change to my District 24 to make it as close to perfect for me:

- I like to blend in with the crowd--think "Gray Man"--so I got rid of the bright orange pull tabs and added some simple black nylon pulls for the main compartment. The orange MR logo on the front still sticks out, but the black zipper pulls makes it way less conspicuous. MR could probably save a little by getting rid of the orange pull tabs, too.
- Including strap keepers for the main harness would be awesome. Loose straps bug me.
- I'd like to forego the front admin pocket flap's Velcro closure and go with neodymium magnets. It'd be quiet and secure.
- I'd move the lanyard from the top compartment into the front admin compartment. The top compartment will easily fit (sun)glasses or eye protection, but with the bare lanyard there's a chance that the lenses will get scratched unless you add the extra bulk of a case.
- Redesign the front admin compartment. I'll echo another reviewer's comment that it almost feels like this compartment was quickly designed. As mentioned before, locate the lanyard in there, reconfigure and add more pockets to include one or two with a zipper that'll fit a typical-sized man's wallet. Have one pocket next to the writing tool sleeves be sized to fit a contemporary 18650-sized flashlight.

It seems like a lot of wants, but I'm truly nit-picking here to make this pack near-perfect for me for my purposes. I see myself using this and not wanting a new pack for a while (unless they release a new and improved variant).
review.name: Great quality EDC bag

review.reviewBody: Could not be happier.  Best organized pack I've ever owned.
review.name: Awesome!

review.reviewBody: I bought this for air travel and glad I did, very well made and durable. Great feature that let’s you open it all the way without the front flopping over!
review.name: Very well made

review.reviewBody:
Side pockets are too shallow. My water bottle slips out if I lay the backpack down. 

Would like more pockets inside. Like a high wide pocket inside the front panel. And some low ones inside the main compartment. Thank you.
review.name: Side pockets shallow

review.reviewBody: The front pocket does not lie flat.  It is forever creased and it does not seem like it was well thought out.  If they could fix this as well as some of the slit pocket organizational features this would be a 5 star product.  Only feature missing is a luggage passthrough, which I wish more backpack designers would incorporate.
review.name: Good Features but not the best execution

review.reviewBody: Great durability and construction.  Good amount of storage and interior compartments and pockets.  I like how you can access the front compartment from the side and you can open up main compartment from the top or open it completely up.  Wish is had some small loops on the outside or straps to hook things to.  Overall very happy with the pack
review.name: Overall one of the best backpacks I’ve owned

review.reviewBody: Now that it has been used for a few weeks, I can say I continue to be impressed with Mystery Ranch.  The quality is excellent, from the materials to the construction.  It is fairly light when empty, yet very sturdy.  It is great for taking to work or travel.
review.name: Great product, quality, price!

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable fit , fabric. and chamois.  I especially love the drop tail design and color choices. I can't understand why other manufacturers aren't converting to a similiar design.  Oh well, their loss. I'm 5'4", 36" hips and the Med fits perfectly (the small was a bit snug)
review.name: Most comfortable bibs in my wardrobe

review.reviewBody: Girlfriend loves the fit and said it was comfortable on the bike. We tried a few brands and this is her favorite. But I noticed that after the first ride the fabric is starting to wear and pill in the seat area. So I’m worried about how well they will hold up over time.
review.name: Questionable durability

review.reviewBody: I really wish I didn’t like these bibs so much because they’re so expensive but they’re worth it. I have three pairs that I rotate through and I get very annoyed when I forget to do bike laundry and have to wear anything else. I ride XC in them 3-5 days a week, and also used them as liners for racing enduro. They show almost zero wear after ~14 months of use, except for one pair that has a few pinholes in the leg from a high speed XC crash.
review.name: Worth every penny

review.reviewBody: I have worn this for 12+ rides and so comfy. I love that it has a drop tail for mid-ride breaks. I have ridden both MTB and Road with this bib and it does its job for both. The Chamois is also in a great spot for me!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I wanted to like this one, but like the other Pro bib in this line, it either nails it or fails. Very tight straps, but nailed the material, easy to get off, with a nice feel and center clip. But the straps have a raw edge. They will wear out faster. Love handle area came up too short and feels weird, but no underwear line. Legs had a great material, such a silky feel, but not supper grippy. Chaomis: 7/10. Average width in the butt area, and on the more padded side. I returned it because of my longer torso, and the weird midsection.
review.name: complete review

name: Pro Bib Short - Women's

hasVariant.name: 20oz Insulated Food Jar
hasVariant.description: Buy the Hydro Flask 20oz Insulated Food Jar online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought one for myself and each of my nieces and nephews - thank goodness I tried mine out before giving them as gifts. I warmed the jar with boiling water for 5 minutes before putting my piping hot food into the container in the morning, and less than four hours, at lunch time, the food was luke warm at best. The fact that the container itself, and the lid, were warm was a really bad indicator. Clearly all the heat escaped. I have to return the ones I bought as gifts and rush to find something else. I do NOT recommend this product and I am confused by all of the good reviews.
review.name: Does not keep food hot

review.reviewBody: I bought this in the spring for when I have lunch in my car about 4-5 hours in the work day. Every time I pre heat it & close tightly and every single time I’ve used this my food is lukewarm. I’ve done chili a few times and chowder all with the prep & some times have been 40° other times 60-70°. I don’t know if mine was a dud but it’s disappointing.
review.name: Doesn’t keep food hot.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Took 4 tries but my order was finally filled properly! Use my hydro flask every day!! 20oz container used for overnight oats. Perfect size and perfect opening
review.name: Daily use for overnight oats

review.reviewBody: I love my insulated food jar, honestly enough to probably buy more. I love packing all my food in these (despite them being a tad bulky). Would love to see an adult type of bento box that can keep food super warm/cold!
review.name: Kept my foods warm AND cold!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love it! Perfect for basketball nights and eating on the go!! Dishwasher safe, for real!
review.name: Helpful for our busy season!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality. Keeps food warm or cold all day. It’s a good size too, enough for a filling lunch. I got the green and it’s very pretty
review.name: Great quality. Keeps food warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like the size of this jar and the color but I was disappointed it didn’t keep my food hot like I thought it would…..keeps it lukewarm at best. I even tried preheating it with hot water to see if it helped. I feel the coffee travel mugs keep drinks hotter for longer. Not sure if the technology is different or these are meant more for cold food items
review.name: Kinda disappointed

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My daughter loves this pink food jar.
review.name: Nice color and nice printed name

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Threw away our other food jars that wasn’t keeping our school lunches warm. Be careful though- lids get easily stained when washing with other dirty dishes and is hard to come off.
review.name: Keeps food warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect size for my daughter to take rice to school!
