description: Buy the Snow Peak Mesh Folding Chair online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mesh Folding Chair
hasVariant.description: Buy the Snow Peak Mesh Folding Chair online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The Snow Peak folding chair is the Cadillac of folding chairs, easily supporting my 6’4”, 220-pound frame with both ease and comfort. This review is for the mesh version of this chair, which is fantastic for hot weather. However, when it starts to cool down, I prefer the canvas version—I own two of those as well. Alternatively, I just throw on some pants and a sweater, and I’m good to go.

I highly recommend these chairs from Snow Peak. They are super high-quality, comfortable, and heavy-duty, so you never have to worry about them breaking when you sit down. The only downside is that they’re not particularly portable, making them unsuitable for hiking to a campsite. However, they’re perfect for car camping.

With these chairs, you’ll be directing your campsite in style. The only problem? Everyone else will want to sit in them, so you might have to keep buying more!
review.name: Snow Peak Mesh folding chair for summer!

name: Mesh Folding Chair

description: Buy the Simms Hardbite Vibram Stud - 20-Pack online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Hardbite Vibram Stud - 20-Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Simms Hardbite Vibram Stud - 20-Pack online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Quick to add, great for increased freestone grip.   Make your wading experience safer
review.name: Safety for your wading boots

review.reviewBody: Took my time installing them and used aqua seal on each one. I’ve used the boots twice since installing them. They are all still in place and seemed to help.
review.name: Work well.

review.reviewBody: Indispensable during the spring when algae grows on the river rocks.
review.name: Hard bite  equals upright

review.reviewBody:
When in Alaska I was slipping on the moss on the rocks and the guide was not. I noticed later in the hunt he had the studs in his boots and was getting around a lot easier.
 So now I have them :).
I haven’t tried them myself but have seem in action.
review.name: Alaska black bear hunt

review.reviewBody: No complaints. They screwed in snugly with a 1/4" driver. Haven't fallen out or worn down after a few days use. Helped with traction on all-rubber soles, probably be evern better with felt.
review.name: Good Studs

review.reviewBody: I fly fish on the rivers in the southeast. There is always mossy rocks that we are walking on and after slipping and falling several times I purchased the HardBite Wading Boot Studs for my wading boots.  I have not fallen since.  I feel much more stable because I am not slipping at all.  They are easy to install.
review.name: A Great Addition to a Wading Boot.

review.reviewBody: After fishing for a season without them, for safety I acquired 20 of these studs. Online I saw patterns of installation and with my cordless drill and the 1/4” socket, I had these done in 5-10 min. Out on the water, walking on stream rocks was clearly safer and I did not need to use my collapsible walking staff to feel secure.
review.name: Safer now

review.reviewBody: Made a huge difference in traction on algae-covered rocks, etc.
review.name: Don’t wade without them

review.reviewBody:
Fitted these to my G3 Guide Vibram Boots, also used Aquaseal. 

They provide little extra grip as the do not protrude from the sole of the boot. And no, I did not over tighten them!

The "welded carbide gripper pellets designed to enhance traction and durability" would work if they had not had an argument with the rest of the stud and stayed welded in place after 5 uses. See photo.

Overall, IMHO they are a complete waste of money and Aquaseal - very disappointed.

Bryan - from South Wales UK.
review.name: Very Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I was sold this part as a plug and play replacement for the 53-G Shimano part. The machining is quite inferior compared to the Shimano, the stainless pin is way too long and needs to be cut down with a grinder to not interfere with the crank. And the bolt recess doesn't fit the stock Shimano bolts. Once I did my best to modify to fit shifting was never smooth and the parts never quite seated flat on the crank spindles. In short, this ended up being a waste of money and I had to go elsewhere to get the Dura-Ace parts.
review.name: Not a good fit with 2005 Dura-Ace

review.reviewBody: Lovely, cosy and warm.  On the large size, but great warm layer.
review.name: Lovely!

review.reviewBody: Gorgeous! This is so cosy and perfect for cold mornings. I am usually an XS but bought the XXS and it fits perfect, with enough room for a jumper underneath.
review.name: Cosy!

review.reviewBody: Lovely and cosy fleece jacket which looks beautiful on! Almost too good to wear when I’m all hot and sweaty.
review.name: Snuggly and Stylish at the same time!

review.reviewBody: Very thick and cozy. Definetly oversized, if you dont like the oversized look size down to haver a normal fit. Extremely soft and warm. Very good quality.

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket to go to the gym, but I’ve discovered it’s rather bulky, so I really don’t wear it unless it’s very very cold out.
review.name: Little to big

review.reviewBody:
Lovely jacket, warm and cosy, and the fleece is beautifully soft.  It is very versatile and I look forward to wearing it.  I wish the side pockets had zip closures but that didn't put me off as the pockets are of a good size.I like that it can be adjusted woth an elastic around the bottom.
I read some of the other reviews and ordered both sizes XS (my usual SB size) and XXS.  I kept the XXS as it is quite a generous cut.
review.name: Very versatile, soft and cosy

review.reviewBody: Nice quality fleece, roomy and great either as an extra layer or just as a jacket. Opted for next size up so I could layer up.  Nice colour block. Couple of areas for improvement, outer chest pocket not big enough to fit my phone which is annoying and inner pockets stitched on with one thread - not sure how long that will last.
review.name: Comfy extra layer jacket

review.reviewBody: Gorgeous jacket, lovely soft material but unfortunately just too oversized for me, really didn’t suit me so had to return. Disappointed though as I loved the jacket!
review.name: Gorgeous teddy fleece

review.reviewBody: I loved this jacket, lovely fit, beautiful quality, lovely soft fleece, fully lined so extra warm, my issue is that the majority of the fleece is black and I was after a navy fleece so sadly returned. If it had been all navy as advertised I would definitely have kept it.
review.name: Gorgeous jacket but predominantly black

hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Ascent Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I adore this sleeping bag. I have taken it on one practice trip before a long backpacking trip, and I was very comfortable in about 50 without lots of layers. I love that you can stick your arms and feet out, or even start your morning as a little coffee-drinking caterpillar if it's dry outside. Unfortunately, it poured on our first camping trip, and the bag got a little damp (heartbreak!), but it dried very quickly when I laid it out. No problems so far!
review.name: It's perfect!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a lovely sleeping bag. My only caveat is as I am 5’6” it just fits. I wish I had ordered the long
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The way I am 100% obsessed with this sleeping bag. As a camper, I need a durable good quality one, that will keep me warm but also allow me freedom to move. 
This has snaps at the top so you can keep your chest warm but your arms free and a zippered bottom so you can open up for your feet’s freedom but also have the ability to tuck your feet in and leave it unzipped. 
Used this for camping at a music festival with wind gusts up to 40mph. I was cozy all night!
review.name: OBSESSED

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Hands down the absolute best sleeping bag on the market. The women’s one is slightly warmer and more filled than the men’s one. Where my girlfriend sleeps colder than me, it’s absolutely perfect. The women’s and men’s ascent zip together for couples, it packs down to the perfect size to fit into my osprey atmos ag 50 sleeping bag compartment. I’ve used it down to 25 degrees and it is very comfortable. 
Keeps you very warm
Packs down 
zippers work better than any bag I’ve ever used
Sides and bottom unzip so you can use your arms and legs outside of the bag
review.name: SPEND THE MONEY!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a super comfortable bag! Normally, I’m incredibly uncomfortable with a sleeping pad and bag, but the Ascent bag was so cozy! Kept me warm through the night, and the zip downs on the side were great for preventing overheating. It’s a bag that feels nice to slip into after a long day of hiking, and at around one pound, didn’t add to much to my pack. I’m excited to keep using this for the season.
review.name: Cozy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I Love the shape of this sleeping bag and that it’s made for a female body and stature. Can’t wait to take it fall camping , and am excited to break it out this summer. It’s compact and easy to bring along on the road.
review.name: Comfy and warm

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am so excited to have received this sleeping bag! I plan on using it for our upcoming Yosemite trip. The color has two variations of green, which looks great and very eye catching. The durability of this sleeping bag is amazing and I know it will last multiple backpacking trips. The bag it comes in has two handles, making it easy to attach to my backpack using a carabiner at the top. It's super light, and I can roll it even tighter if needed, which is a huge plus for longer hikes. 

I was able to test it out in my living room and it has just enough space to not feel claustrophobic but keep me warm. The amount of down filling is impressive and I’m looking forward to  a comfortable night's sleep after a long day of backpacking Yosemite!
review.name: Green with Backpacking Envy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am in love with this Sea to Summit sleeping bag. It’s the Ascent Women’s Down bag. The color is pretty and I like the aesthetic. It’s super portable. The bag is easy to carry. It can pack down small and is super light. I like all the zipper features. It’s cool that you can zip up but still leave your legs and arms sticking out. It’s very warm inside. The hood is nice as well. The size is perfect for me. Overall this bag is great and I would recommend.
review.name: Really incredible sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received a free Ascent Women’s down sleeping bag by seatosummit in exchange for my honest review. This sleeping bag is extremely well made. The material is so soft and the weight is light as well for backpacking. This is rated to keep you warm in as low as 15 degrees Fahrenheit. The weather near me was not that cold but it is very warm and comfortable. The design is well thought out and I especially like how the head area curves in and can be tightened to keep out the cold. This sleeping bag is the regular size and is large enough for a woman that is 5’7’’. With that being said, I am 5’10 and I weigh 175lbs. Although I am past the recommended height restriction, I was still able to fit in this sleeping bag. My toes were right up against the bottom but it wasn’t uncomfortable. I assume that the long would be even more comfortable for my body type. The color is nice and reminds me of an avocado- dark green on the outside and light green on the inside. There is also a well thought out pocket on the inside for small items such as a phone or keys. For such a warm sleeping bag, I am super impressed with how small it can be folded into. This would be a fantastic addition for any serious hikers/campers who are looking to stay warm after a long day of hiking.
review.name: Compact, warm and well made- extremely durable construction

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag is so soft and comfortable!  It feels like your bundled up in clouds.  It’s feels well insulated and it’s easy to pack and unpack from its bag.  It’s a pretty 2 tone green color and I’m sure it will keep me warm camping on chilly nights!
review.name: Soft and fluffy

name: Ascent Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Women's

review.reviewBody: These worked great. Very versatile warm and comfortable. Stayed dry the whole day.
review.name: Awesome pants

review.reviewBody: Look amazing feel heavy dude the liner is ez to take out for warmer days
review.name: 686 smarty pants

review.reviewBody: I currently have 2x pairs and couldn’t be happier. Liner system is great, plenty of pockets and great fit.
review.name: Love these pants!

review.reviewBody: I've initiated a return (doubts about the color) just to realize how awesome those pants are. Nope, not sending back. These pants are really awesome. Remind me of a similar design I purchased exactly 20 years ago in Vail, CO. Classic cargo snowboard pants. Great for all weather conditions (removable parts + vents). Very comfortable, highly recommend.
review.name: Very satisfied

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just a great pair of pants. They offer a ton of pockets, for safe keeping of any goods you may be carrying. Water proof even on rainy days yet somehow still breathable in those conditions. The inner liner is so comfortable and warm, I could wear them all winter. Great for pajamas and casual wear. I have yet to wear both pants together, because it’s just not cold enough here. The style is amazing too. Feels like the old school sessions days, as it is a looser fit.
review.name: Killer pants!

review.reviewBody: Size large was way too big for me. I usually wear 33 waist, 30 inseam but I was swimming in these and had to return. 686 did honor a return thankfully so kudos to them for that. Too bad they were out of Medium because the pants are great.
review.name: Great pants, size runs big.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This things are awesome! They are build good, feel good, and most importantly look the part.
review.name: This things are awesome! They

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The function of this cargo pant is amazing ! Mobility was smooth and no restraints. Waterproofing was no problem for this pants . Very adjustable in many ways when it comes to layering it and all the compartments it has .
review.name: The function of this cargo

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wore these during spring condition. The vents are nice and breathable. I like the idea of having plenty of pockets. Still have to try them out in blizzard conditions but I'm sure they'll do great especially with the liner.
review.name: Plenty of pockets, great pants.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really comfortable pants and I love the built-in fleece liner. Warm and ultra waterproof.
review.name: My new favorite pants

name: Smarty Cargo 3-In-1 Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Two comments: 1) the Look Pivot 12s are likely all that I need now that I'm in my late 70s and no longer racing. 2) I paid more than I should as Backcountry would not match my PSIA discount and returning them would have cost me shipping fees which would have narrowed, but not eliminated the price difference.
review.name: These bindings are just what I need.

review.reviewBody:
The toe piece on this binding broke after 1/2 season of use and now have to get new bindings in the middle of the season.

The local ski shop indicated they had seen this particular failure on at least 4 other occasions, and Look will not warranty.  I am going to attempt to process a warranty claim but not sure if I want to mount these on any skis moving forward.

My son rides his skis hard but expected better durability.  I am having a Marker Griffon mounted on his skis today.
review.name: Not durable, broke after 1/2 season

review.reviewBody: Mounted these on some 172 Nordica 104 Frees for my daughter, step up from 164's to the 172s and wanted to insure safety.  She skied them 4 days at Beaver Creek and Keystone Dec. 30-Jan 2, 2024.  First rides and she rocked them with amazing bindings the Look 12 pivots.
review.name: Daddy's girl

review.reviewBody: Simply the performing since the heel can move up 25mm and then come back in! Awesome in chatter, crud and big air landings.
review.name: Best retention (performance), best release (safety)...what else do you need?

name: Pivot 12 GW Ski Binding - 2025

review.reviewBody: In general I like these snowshoes. But last night tromping through 18" of fresh powder in sub-freezing temperature I found the Achilles heel of these snowshoes. Twice the snowshoes came off. The plastic straps that hold your feet to the shoe lost there elasticity and would not stretch like they do in somewhat warmer conditions. If you are looking for snowshoes for these conditions I advise you look for a different strapping system that is more pliable.
review.name: Poor strap material/design

review.reviewBody: Love the Bodega boots. I ride a decent amount of park but also everywhere on the mountain and the medium stiffness and double BOA allows me to maintain comfort all day. The first thing I really like about this boot is just the fit. It already felt like it was broken in right out of the box so it was instant comfort on the hill while feeling very secure. With that said, I've already had them for a full season and they don't feel packed out even as a medium flex boot. The double BOA is also fantastic for loosening the boots in between runs and then easily snapping them tight again. Highly recommend this boot for the park rats or resorts boarders if you want something comfortable yet very responsive and reliable!
review.name: Great Simple Boot for Anything!

name: Bodega BOA Snowboard Boot - 2024 - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo II Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit. Beautiful, comfortable, flattering and keeps me warm. Great price too! I'm so excited and I want the cold days to come already!
review.name: I'm amazed!

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo II Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love that wind doesn’t come through this jacket, and looks nice and flattering.
review.name: Great jacket

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo II Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this coat, I bought it for our Alaska cruise. No disappointments here. I ended up buying one for my mom
review.name: Love this coat

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo II Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the color and fit of it. I love the fact of it being water 💧 resistant
review.name: Love it

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo II Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Beautiful color,  nice lines, seems warm enough (not tested yet). I like the combination of zipper and snaps to give versatility if you need to adjust temperature.  I have many Columbia products and I’d have to confirm some of the other reviews….the shoulders are very snug. Since I chose to go with the size chart, I ordered a size S. It will only accommodate a light sweater but should be sufficient for trips to Japan and Germany. One other irritant was a sticky zipper that wanted to misalign. I waxed the end of the zipper and it seems fine but will require care getting started each time.
review.name: Form fitting warm jacket

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo II Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It keeps me nice and warm when standing outside in winter. I love the elastic strings to tighten the hood from the wind. It also really helps that all the pockets have zippers.
review.name: Great winter coat!

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo II Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was so nervous this coat wouldn’t be as warm as my giant overstuffed Canada goose. However it is just as warm if not warmer! I got it on clearance at the end of the season sale and thought I wouldn’t know until winter if it was worth it. However I live in Chicago so winter weather in April is not unusual. It withstands cold blowing winds and the only thing cold were my hands. And unlike my giant Canada goose coat I can actually drive in it! I also don’t feel like the kid from A Christmas Story!
review.name: Love it more than my Canada goose down coat

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo II Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit. Love the color, weight and fit of this jacket.
review.name: Love this jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo II Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: My wife loved this jacket. It fit perfectly and warm enough for NW area
review.name: Excellent jacket

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo II Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Fits perfectly and it has shape to it tapering in at the waist.  Longer than expected but with the shirt tail hem is very flattering.  Not your regular puffy coat but has style to it.  Looking forward to many years of wear.
review.name: Awesome coat!

name: Mountain Croo II Mid Down Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Bought these as a Christmas present for a friend. This is her 2nd pair and she absolutely loves them. The name says it all- Xtratuf. They are durable and comfortable.
review.name: Christmas tuf’s

review.reviewBody: Love the style and fit. Great for gardening and walking your pets.
review.name: Great to wear for many jobs.

review.reviewBody: PLEASE BE CAREFUL WEARING THESE BOOTS ON DIAMOND PLATING OR IN SLICK CONDITIONS. After a long run with xtratuf I have had two back to back lemons, this boot included. You cant boast slip resistant in the bottom of the shoe and then be literal plastic skates. I wore them one time on a dewy boat deck, went for my rod and almost went into the ocean. I've use my old xtratuf boots all the time in adverse weather with no issue. I used to buy them for work because of their grip. I hope they have redesigned the shoe since I bought my pair. Sadly, I wont be buying any deck boots from this company again.
review.name: Slip and Slide
comment:
Hello,
We would not expect these boots to cause you to be sliding around and slipping.  Please reach out to our customer service team so we can make sure that you get boots you are 100% satisfied with.  xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.reviewBody: Easy slip on boot for any wet and muddy conditions(or to do gardening in!) Run large so I did size down..a whole size
review.name: Durable, practical and comfortable boot

review.reviewBody: I was super excited about these.  I've been on a quest for perfect ankle puddle boots for stomping around in.  These run BIG.  My actual shoe size is 8.5.  I sized down to size 8.  They were a full size too large, at least.  The ankle opening was too large for my preference as well (it's impressive, because I have muscular/athletic build & frequently run into the opposite problem).  They were lightweight, but didn't offer the sole support I was looking for either.  Overall, underwhelmed & not worth the money.
review.name: Not my style - runs large and lacks support

review.reviewBody: Comfy, waterproof, and even somewhat warm in Alaska winter!
review.name: Great Boot!

review.reviewBody: Excellent boot, very comfortable and good in warm or cold temperatures.  I wear them all day and never think about my feet so that's comfort.
review.name: Boot

review.reviewBody: I work in a fish house. 5days/10hrs a week on wet, icy concrete. This boot is comfortable with a arch support & is actually non slip (way more then the xtra tuff "deck boot") Will be ordering again.
review.name: Great boots to work in a fish house

review.reviewBody: I got these as a Christmas gift from my boyfriend! I absolutely adore them. They're the best shoes I own. They're insanely tough and durable.
review.name: LOVE THESE

review.reviewBody: I love these boots because they are so comfortable and easy to put on and take off! I use them while working out in the yard. Mowing grass and on a rainy day !
review.name: Comfortable boot!

name: Wheelhouse Ankle 6in Deck Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I'm very pleased with the helmet overall. It's lightweight and comfortable, and the Mips technology is a great feature. The only thing I wasn't keen on was the triangle piece under the ear, which isn't adjustable. The plastic piece sits awkwardly on my jawbone for my head size and shape. I made sure I had the correct size helmet. Previous versions had an adjustable strap divider there, but the new version isn't adjustable.
review.name: Comfortable Except for the Straps

review.reviewBody: Have had this helmet for over 6 months. Have used on road and mountain bike rides and races. Good fit, comfortable, fairly light. If you’re wondering, you can still stow your riding glasses in the helmet with the honeycomb padding.
review.name: Solid Helmet

review.reviewBody: Returning the helmet not because of the quality of the helmet but because of the straps near the ears not being adjustable.
review.name: Smith Trace Mips

review.reviewBody: I like a lot of things about this helmet. Looks good, ventilation is fine, and the fit is okay EXCEPT for the vapor-fit dial adjustment system. It sits higher around the back of the head than other helmets, and when tightened securely is somewhat uncomfortable. Also, the dial adjuster is nearly impossible to turn when your hands are sweaty. Difficult to adjust on the fly. Needs some knurling on the surface to improve grip. Frankly, I've worn other several other brands that fit my head better, including Specialized, Kask, and Rudy Project (which I ruined in a crash and was unable to replace with the same color). This Smith Trace was on sale when I purchased it online. Should have tried it on first but could not find one locally
review.name: Good not great helmet

review.reviewBody:
I just had a crash at a bike event. I sustained a concussion along with other minor jnjuries. I do not recall the circumstances of or immediately after the accident. I do feel this helmet protected me from much more severe head injuries. Trace has mips but also the “honeycomb” structure of koroyd. There is little perceptible damage to the helmet. 
I have to buy a new one now but I wish the crash sensor was incorporated into the hi-vis colored trace. Why not?!
review.name: Trace Saved me!

review.reviewBody: Very nice helmet, light, comfortable and well ventilated. Integrated bug screens are also much welcome.
review.name: Excellent choice!

review.reviewBody: I bought a second one for my son after using one for over a year.  It is easy to adjust for fitting, has very good ventilation, is light weight, and works well with sunglasses.  Seems it is more comfortable that lower priced, older helmets that I have used.
review.name: Good Protection

review.reviewBody: This helmet saved my life! During a crash, the side of my head and face hit the pavement. While I did get a lot of road rash on my face and a black eye from my glasses, the helmet kept my skull safe. No concussion! Aside from its life saving benefits, this helmet's fit and airflow was comfortable, it was easy to adjust, and it looked cute!
review.name: Life Saving & Cute to Boot!

review.reviewBody: Needed an upgrade on my helmet for both safety and comfort reasons. This one definitely meets those needs. It's very comfortable and has good airflow. I got it on sale, so it's definitely worth the investment.
review.name: updgrading helmet for road cycling

review.reviewBody: Fits extremely well, very adjustable. Airflow could be better, but it never feels overly hot even on the warmest days.
review.name: Fits extremely well, very adjustable.

name: Trace Mips Helmet
